article_title: Mark Levin: No Distance Between Hillary Clinton, Lindsey Graham And Marco Rubio On Foreign Policy
article_text:
MARK LEVIN: Lindsey Graham votes for every nominee this radical president puts forward.



Lindsey Graham--whether it's Obamacare, whether it's the outrageous immigration situation, whether it's same-sex marriage, which is a decision the states should be making--Lindsey Graham keeps telling us to move on and to move along.



When it comes to the massive national debt, Lindsey Graham supports it.



When it comes to taking the United States military and sending ground troops in every hellhole all over the Earth, Lindsey Graham supports it.



That's not conservatism, that's not being hawk, a that is utterly irresponsible and unconscionable.



Reagan is one of our greatest presidents because of both his domestic and foreign policy accomplishments.



He defeated the Soviet Union. We never invaded any country! Around the USSR, he squeezed them until they collapsed during the Bush administration. He surrounded them with our allies. He spent them into disaster. We used surrogates, we used satellite countries, and, yes, we used our military, but we didn't invade. We weren't sending American troops everywhere. As a matter of fact, off the top off my head, I believe the only place we actually invaded was Grenada.



Lindsey Graham doesn't know what the hell he's talking about! Lindsey, Lindsey--it's Mama. Come back, Lindsey!



And quite frankly I don't see a hell of a lot of distance between Lindsey Graham and Marco Rubio.



You know what's going on in Libya today? Al-Qaeda is on the run, ISIS is on the run! Egypt is being threatened. Europe is being threatened. You know what is right across from the Mediterranean Sea?



Europe, that's right, right across from Tripoli.



Lindsey Graham, John McCain, Barack Obama, Hillary Clinton, and, yes, even Marco Rubio--they have lit a light to this part of the world, they lit a match. No, I am not an isolationist, no, I am not Ron Paul, no, I am not Pat Buchanan. I am a conservative, Reaganite, strong defense hawk, but you don't intervene in every situation.



We're not out to create new societies, we're out to sustain our own society. We're out to protect our allies and our allies are out to protect us. Let's see Saturday night if there are any serious questions in this regard to Marco Rubio, or is it all going to be: "Dr. Carson, what do you about the ethics of Ted Cruz?" "Marco Rubio, what do you think about the ethics of Ted Cruz?" "Donald Trump, what do you think about it?"

article_metadata.description:
MARK LEVIN: Lindsey Graham votes for every nominee this radical president puts forward.

Lindsey Graham, whether it is Obamacare, the outrgeous immigration situation, same sex marriage, which is a decision that should be left to the states, Lindsey Graham keeps telling us to move on.

When it comes to the massive national debt, Lindsey Graham supports it.

When it comes to sending the U.S. military all around the earth, Lindsey Graham supports it. 

That's not conservatism, that's not being  hawk, that is utterly irresponsible and unconscionable.

Reagan is one of our finest presidents for both his foreign policy and economic accomplishments.

He defeated the Soviet Union without ever invading a country around the USSR. he squeezed them until they collapsed during the Bush administration... We used surrogates, satellite countries, but we didn't invade. Off the top off my head, I think the only country we invaded was Grenada. 

Lindsey Graham doesn't know what the hell he's talking about...

And quite frankly I don't see a hell of a lot of distance between Lindsey Graham and Marco Rubio.

You know what's going on in Libya today? ISIS is on the run, al-Qaeda is on the run, Egypt is being threatened. Europe is being threatened. You know what is right across from the Mediterranean Sea? 

Europe, that's right, right across from Tripoli. 

Lindsey Graham, John McCain, Hillary Clinton, Marco Rubio -- they have lit a light to this part of the world, they lit  a match. No, I am not an isolationist, no I am not Ron Paul, no I am not Pat Buchanan. I am a conservative Reaganite strong defense hawk, but you don't intervene in every situation. 

We're not out to create new societies, we're out to preserve our own. We're out to protect our allies and our allies are out to protect us. Let's see Saturday night if there are any serious questions in that regard to Marco Rubio, or will it be: "Dr. Carson, what do you think of Ted Cruz's ethics?" "Marco Rubio, what do you think about the ethics of Ted Cruz?" "Donald Trump, what do you think about it?"

...

This issue about amending the [2013] gang of eight [immgration bill]. What Ted Cruz meant, what Jeff Sessions meant, or Mike Lee. Let me tell you something. Those men and others should never had to have offered amendments to that bill because that bill should never have been presented. Those eight senators, proposed such a monstrous bill, there were other Senators trying to figure out any way they could stop it. 

And we've reached a point, here in debate 2,700 or whatever it is, where this back and forth, where the moderators say, well actually you agreed with me and you supported amnesty, or whatever it is. The point is, no one would have had to present poison pill amendments that are now being twisted if that bill had never been in the first place.

That bill would have a been a dagger in the heart of this country, you never would have recognized it again. Tht's what Chuck Schumer was up to, that's what Dick Durbin and Lindsey Graham were up to. And that's what Marco Rubio was up to.
article_metadata.title: Mark Levin: No Distance Between Hillary Clinton, Lindsey Graham And Marco Rubio On Foreign Policy
